medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began in the right lower quadrant and has progressed to more periumbilical pain over the course of 3 days, accompanied by anorexia, fevers, chills, and fatigue/malaise. In the emergency department, the patient vomited a large amount, with some blood in it.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary artery disease, peripheral vascular disease, non-insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus, sleep apnea, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, esophagitis, diverticulitis, prior EGD revealing gastritis and esophagitis, history of adenomatous polyps and colonoscopy.
medical_history.family_history: Positive for colorectal cancer in grandmother and aunt.
medical_history.social_history: Tobacco abuse and heavy alcohol use in the past.
